facts: Jesus taught that the greatest commandments are to love God with all your heart and to love your neighbor as yourself.
In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus explained that God cares about our thoughts and attitudes, not just our outward actions.
Many Bible teachings use parables, which are short stories with a deeper lesson, like the Good Samaritan showing kindness to anyone in need.
The Bible teaches forgiveness by encouraging people to forgive others, just as they hope to be forgiven.
Jesus taught the Golden Rule: treat others the way you want to be treated.
The Bible often teaches humility, meaning we should not think we are better than others and should be willing to serve.
Teachings about faith explain that trusting God can guide choices and give courage during hard times.
sources_hint: Look up these teachings in Matthew 5–7, Matthew 22:37–40, Luke 10:25–37, Matthew 6:14–15, Luke 6:31, and Philippians 2:3–4.
